text.div:
QICore

The official URL for this implementation guide is: 

http://hl7.org/fhir/us/qicore/ImplementationGuide/hl7.fhir.us.qicore

The QICore Implementation Guide defines a set of FHIR profiles with extensions and bindings needed to create interoperable, quality-focused applications. The profiles in this implementation guide derive from and extend the US Core profiles to provide a common foundation for building, sharing, and evaluating knowledge artifacts across quality improvement efforts in the US Realm.

name: QICore
title: QI-Core Implementation Guide
description: The QICore Implementation Guide defines a set of FHIR profiles with extensions and bindings needed to create interoperable, quality-focused applications. The profiles in this implementation guide derive from and extend the [US Core](http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core) profiles to provide a common foundation for building, sharing, and evaluating knowledge artifacts across quality improvement efforts in the US Realm.

grouping.name: Structures: Resource Profiles
grouping.description: These define constraints on FHIR resources for systems conforming to this implementation guide

grouping.name: Structures: Extension Definitions
grouping.description: These define constraints on FHIR data types for systems conforming to this implementation guide

grouping.name: Terminology: Value Sets
grouping.description: These define sets of codes used by systems conforming to this implementation guide

grouping.name: Terminology: Code Systems
grouping.description: These define new code systems used by systems conforming to this implementation guide

grouping.name: Knowledge Artifacts: Libraries
grouping.description: These define logic, asset collections and other libraries as part of content in this implementation guide

grouping.name: Example: Example Instances
grouping.description: These are example instances that show what data produced and consumed by systems conforming with this implementation guide might look like

resource.name: RAND Appropriateness Score Codes
resource.description: The RAND scoring for appropriateness of the procedure.

resource.name: QICore Condition Criticality Codes
resource.description: Value Set for QICore Condition Criticality (Example)

resource.name: QICore Diagnostic Order Precondition
resource.description: The condition, state, or problem that the patient is in or has prior to a therapy or procedure. This captures temporal (temporary circumstances) that have bearing on the data that it qualifies but will not necessarily modify its meaning. Things like 'after activity', 'at rest', or 'post-op'.

resource.name: QICore Observation Verification Method Codes
resource.description: Code for method by which the observation result was validated, e.g., human review, sliding average.

resource.name: Reasons for refuting allergy or intolerance codes
resource.description: The value set to instantiate this attribute should be drawn from a terminologically robust code system for reasons of refuting an allergy or intolerance. This value set is provided as a suggestive example.

resource.name: RAND Appropriateness Scores
resource.description: The RAND scoring for appropriateness of the procedure.

resource.name: Precoordinated Body Structures
resource.description: SELECT SNOMED CT code system values representing precoordinated body structures.

resource.name: Communication reason not performed codes
resource.description: Reason communication was not performed. A set of codes specifying the motivation, cause, or rationale of not performing a communication such as being rejected or refused. This value set is provided as a suggestive example.

resource.name: Condition/Diagnosis Certainty
resource.description: Example value set for Condition/Problem/Diagnosis certainty

resource.name: QICore Condition Criticality
resource.description: Value Set for QICore Condition Criticality (Example)

resource.name: Disease Stage Value Set
resource.description: A period or phase in the course of a disease, or the degree of involvement or severity of a disease. Stage acts as a qualifier for the condition.

resource.name: Reasons for canceled or refused encounter codes
resource.description: The value set to instantiate this attribute should be drawn from a terminologically robust code system that consists of or contains concepts to support the encounter process, in particular the process and reasons for canceling or refusing an encounter. This value set is provided as a suggestive example

resource.name: SNOMED CT Qualifier For Type of Diagnosis Codes
resource.description: This value set includes all the "Qualifier for type of diagnosis" SNOMED CT codes (i.e. codes with an is-a relationship with 106229004: Qualifier for type of diagnosis).

resource.name: Flag Category Codes
resource.description: Value Set for Flag Category (Example). This value set defines category codes for Patient Record Flags. Patient record flags is a mechanism in which an alert can be assigned to patients who have certain high risk clinical needs or behavior problems. Flags can be configured to appear during the patient look-up process.

resource.name: Reasons for rejecting goal codes
resource.description: The value set to instantiate this attribute should be drawn from a terminologically robust code system that consists of or contains concepts to support the goal process, in particular the process and reasons for rejecting a goal. This value set is provided as a suggestive example.

resource.name: SNOMED CT Dosages Codes
resource.description: This value set includes all the "Dosages" SNOMED CT codes (i.e. codes with an is-a relationship with 277406006: Dosages).

resource.name: Negation Reason Codes
resource.description: This value set defines the set of codes that can be used to indicate the reason an action was not taken

resource.name: Body Position
resource.description: SNOMED CT code system values descending from the following:'body position finding' 9851009

resource.name: QICore Observation Delta Value Set Definition
resource.description: Code indicating how the current observation compares to previous observations - e.g., no change, rising trend, decreasing trend, etc...

resource.name: QICore Observation Verification Method
resource.description: Code for method by which the observation result was validated, e.g., human review, sliding average.

resource.name: Disability Value Set
resource.description: Disability is broadly defined as a physical or mental condition that limits a person's movements, senses, or activities. This includes  items such as handicap, impairment, invalidism, functional dependency, and incompetence.

resource.name: SNOMED CT Priorities Codes
resource.description: This value set includes all the "Priorities" SNOMED CT codes (i.e. codes with an is-a relationship with 272125009: Priorities).

resource.name: QICoreProcedureType
resource.description: This value set includes example Procedure Type codes

resource.name: QICore Present On Admission Codes
resource.description: Value Set for QICore Present On Admission.

resource.name: Reasons for rejecting a service request
resource.description: The value set to instantiate this attribute should be drawn from a terminologically robust code system for reasons of rejecting or canceling a referral request. This value set is provided as a suggestive example.

resource.name: DoNotPerformReason
resource.description: DoNotPerformReason Extension

resource.name: QICoreDiagnosisPresentOnAdmission
resource.description: Indicator of whether the Encounter diagnosis was present at the time of admission.

resource.name: QICore Model Definition
resource.description: Model definition for the QI-Core IG (v4.1.0) Model

resource.name: QICore Common
resource.description: This library defines functions to expose extensions defined in QICore as fluent functions in CQL, as well as common terminology and functions used in writing CQL with FHIR and QICore profiles.

resource.name: QICore Common Tests
resource.description: This library defines tests for the QICoreCommon library.

resource.name: Not Done Value Set
resource.description: A logical reference (e.g. a reference to ValueSet.url) to a value set/version that identifies a set of possible coded values representing activities that were not requested, ordered, or performed.

resource.name: RAND Appropriateness Score Extension
resource.description: The RAND appropriateness score for the requested procedure.

resource.name: QICoreAdverseEvent
resource.description: An adverse event is an untoward occurrence during treatment that should be reported, for example, to a clinical study sponsor or safety oversight organization.  AEs include reportable serious medical errors such as those defined by National Quality Forum (see http://www.qualityforum.org/Topics/ SREs/List_of_SREs.aspx), and Patient Safety Healthcare Events as defined by AHRQ.  Some AEs can involve conditions such as "recurring headaches" but others do not, such as accidental falls, surgical errors, sexual abuse of patient, and sudden death. An adverse event can also be an unsafe condition that increases the probability of a patient safety event, and near-misses. An adverse event can be caused by exposure to some agent (e.g., a medication, immunization, food, or environmental agent). An adverse reaction can range from a mild reaction, such as a harmless rash to a severe and life-threatening condition. They can occur immediately or develop over time. For example, a patient may develop a rash after taking a particular medication.
